definition[0]: done or produced without formal approval or permission
example[0]: Hodges wrote an unofficial biography of the artist.
definition[1]: not done as part of your job
example[1]: The president made an unofficial visit to the Senator’s house.
definition[2]: without formal approval and permission from the organization or person in authority
example[2]: He made his complaint through unofficial channels.
definition[3]: not made publicly known as part of an official plan
example[3]: Our unofficial policy is to grant two days’ paternity leave.
